message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.io.*;
import java.util.*;
import java.util.ArrayList;

public class Kennel{
    public static void main(String args[])  {  
        String line = ""; // string var to hold entire line  
        if (args.length < 1)   {    
            System.out.println("\n   You forgot to put a file name on the command line.");    
            System.exit(1);   
        };   
        String inFile = args[0];  // file name off command line   
        Scanner sc = null;    
        try   {   
            sc = new Scanner(new File(inFile));   
        }   
        catch (Exception e)   {    
            System.out.println("File not found");    
            System.exit(1);     
        }     
        ArrayList<Dog> dogs = new ArrayList<Dog>();
        while(sc.hasNextLine())    {    
            line = sc.nextLine();    
            StringTokenizer stk = new StringTokenizer(line);    
            String name = stk.nextToken();    
            String breed = stk.nextToken();    
            int month = Integer.parseInt(stk.nextToken());    
            int day = Integer.parseInt(stk.nextToken());    
            int year = Integer.parseInt(stk.nextToken());    
            double weight = Double.parseDouble(stk.nextToken());    
            Dog list = new Dog(name, breed, month, day, year, weight);    
            dogs.add(list);    
        } 
        Dog lightest = dogs.get(0);
        Dog heaviest = dogs.get(0);
        for (Dog dog : dogs) {
            if (dog.getWeight() < lightest.getWeight()) {
                lightest = dog;
            }
            if (dog.getWeight() > heaviest.getWeight()) {
                heaviest = dog;
            }
        }
        System.out.println("The lightest dog is " + lightest.getName() + " and the heaviest dog is " + heaviest.getName());
    } 

    public class Dog {  
        private String dogName;  
        private String dogBreed;  
        private int dogMonth;  
        private int dogDay;  
        private int dogYear;  
        private double dogWeight;
        public Dog(String name, String breed, int month, int day, int year, double weight){  
            dogName = name;  
            dogBreed = breed;  
            dogMonth = month;  
            dogDay = day;  
            dogYear = year;  
            dogWeight = weight; 
        }   
        public String getName(){ return dogName; }
        public String getBreed(){return dogBreed;}
        public String toString(){return String.format("%d/%d/%d", dogMonth, dogDay, dogYear);}
        public double getWeight(){return dogWeight;}
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer.nextToken API is used to break the string into tokens. In this case, it is used to separate the name, breed, date, and weight of the dog from each line of the input file. The tokens are then used to create a new Dog object, which is added to the ArrayList of dogs. After all the dogs have been added to the ArrayList, the program iterates through the list to find the lightest and heaviest dog based on their weight. The names of the lightest and heaviest dogs are then printed out.
